titleStmt.title: G. W. Daniel et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5974

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Esellency Governor Thomas E Bramlette

We the undersigned petitioners, citizens of Owsley County, would represent that at the Term of the Owsley County ^Circuit^ Court 185 Elihu Webber was fined $25.00 or thereabouts for unlawful Gaming, Said Judgement was ^rendered^ some Eight or Ten years since. We would further represent that said Elihu Webber is a poor man, and has very recently returned from the 7th Reg, Inf. Ky, Vol. having served faithfully in said Regiment. for upwards of Three years, and upon his return home he was caught and by the Guerillas and robbed of all his Money, cloting, &C, leaving him destitute of every thing in the clothing line, and Money, We hope that you will use your Executive clemency, and remit all of the fine coming to the Commonwealth of Ky. and in duty bound will ever Petition,

GW Daniel, Late 1st, Lt. Co (A) 7th Reg Ky. Vol.
W. C. Judd Late Co A 7 Ky
W. T. Eager " " " " "
William Bowman, Late Co A 7th Ky
Henry. H. Franklin. Co, A. ^7th^
G h lane
James Snowden
Henry Noland
Samuel P. Kincaid
Late co A 7. Ky,
A B Mcgeres Co. C.
H C Smith

Owsley Cir Ct
vs
E Webber
Remit
8th Nov/64
